targets.rawSql: SELECT instance as "Instance", ip as "IP", cluster as "Cluster", role, module, "group" FROM db_instance WHERE instance = '${instance}'

panels.description: Database count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Databases

panels.description: Distinct users count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Users

panels.description: Distinct pools count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Pools

panels.description: Free clients count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Free Clients

panels.description: Used clients count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Used Clients

panels.description: Login clients count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Login Clients

panels.description: Free servers count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Free Servers

panels.description: Free servers count in this pgbouncer instance
panels.title: Used Servers

panels.description: Transaction committed to $datname db per second in last 1 minute
panels.title: QPS

panels.description: Averge query execution time from pgbouncer
panels.title: Avg Query Time

panels.description: Query per second of this pgbouncer instance group by database
panels.title: QPS

panels.description: Transactions per second of this pgbouncer instance group by database
panels.title: TPS

panels.description: How long the first (oldest) client in the queue has waited, in seconds. If this starts increasing, then the current pool of servers does not handle requests quickly enough. The reason may be either an overloaded server or just too small of a pool_size setting.
panels.title: Max Wait Time
